article_title: Enemy Cruise Missile, Meet the U.S. Rail Gun
article_text:
As Congress meets this month to mark up the fiscal year 2016 National Defense Authorization Act and appropriations bill, members will debate how to best meet tomorrow’s security challenges with today’s finite amount of money. The U.S. built history’s most powerful military through technological innovation. Yet our military advantage is quickly diminishing as other countries acquire comparable capabilities.

China has developed a large and growing ballistic and cruise-missile inventory capable of accurately striking targets...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Congressman Mike Conaway writes that using electricity to fire high-speed projectiles is a relative bargain for the U.S. military at $35,000 per shot.
twitter.title: Enemy Cruise Missile, Meet the U.S. Rail Gun

article_summary:
China has developed a large and growing ballistic and cruise-missile inventory capable of accurately striking targets...
The U.S. built history’s most powerful military through technological innovation.
As Congress meets this month to mark up the fiscal year 2016 National Defense Authorization Act and appropriations bill, members will debate how to best meet tomorrow’s security challenges with today’s finite amount of money.
Yet our military advantage is quickly diminishing as other countries acquire comparable capabilities.
